subject: Learning
title: Mnemonics: Anchors for Recall
description: A fast breakdown of Mnemonics: Anchors for Recall for builders.

hook.text: Every Good Boy Does Fine. You learned that years ago and it still works today.

buildup.text: Mnemonics are mental shortcuts that attach hard-to-remember info to easy-to-remember patterns.

discovery.text: They work by adding structure: rhymes, acronyms, or vivid images create strong retrieval cues.

twist.text: The sillier the image, the better. Bizarre associations are stickier than logical ones.

climax.text: Medical students memorize anatomy with absurd stories. Strangeness is a memory superpower.

punchline.text: The weirder the cue, the stronger the memory.

quiz.question: Why do bizarre mnemonics work well?
options: Unusual associations create stronger retrieval cues
The brain only stores weird information
